lines.dialogueText: William is a scientist who studied fish. He loved searching for strange and rare species from every corner of the world.
He once had an accident, but the memory of what happened is gone. Only a strange feeling remains deep inside him — something that won’t fade away.
The doctor said those lost memories might return if he ever comes across something that could awaken them.
Months passed, yet the memories never returned. So he decided to take a break — hoping it might ease the heavy feeling that still lingered in his heart.
But even then, he had no idea where to go. Until one day, a friend of his — a fisherman — reached out to him.
Hey, William. How have you been? Did your memories ever come back?
Feels the same as always. My memories still haven’t come back either.
I was thinking maybe I should get out for a while… touch some grass, you know? But I have no idea where to go yet.
Then this might be perfect for you. How about going after some strange, rare fish — the kind you’ve always liked?
Sounds interesting. So, what kind of fish are we talking about?
I’m not really sure what it looks like — it’s just a rumor I heard from someone else. But they say the fish can be found somewhere near the Falling Leaves Dam.
The Falling Leaves Dam… near the Evergreen River, right? If I remember correctly, people around there believe in some kind of river god....
Sounds interesting. Are you coming with me?

You know I’m not into catching weird fish like you are.
You should go on your own this time.

Alright then, I’ll go by myself.
Still, thanks for the info — I appreciate it.
No need to thank me for something like that. Anyway, good luck with your fishing — see you around.

After getting the information, William began preparing his special fishing gear — a custom rod with a lure that could move freely underwater, almost like a real fish. It was a new kind of equipment that had become quite popular among modern anglers.
To be sure everything worked, he decided to test the rod at a small pond near his home.
